messages.title: Scottish Labour: because Edinburgh deserves better
messages.content: In just a few weeks, Edinburgh will face a real choice about the type of government we want in Scotland. People are worried about jobs, their future and the cost of living. Household bills are hurting, supermarkets are putting prices up, and the cost of running a car is going through the roof. Now the Tories are back, we need a strong Labour presence in Scotland to focus on the things that really matter, not the SNP who always put independence first.

keyPolicies.policyDescription:
- freeze the council tax for the next TWO years
- oppose the SNP plan for a harsh local income tax

- make a strong priority, with guaranteed apprenticeships for youngsters
- bring back support for unemployed young people to get the chance of a real job
- increase low-paid public service workers' basic pay to £7.15 by cutting top-end bonuses
- make sure Scottish students don't pay tuition fees

issues.economy: Labour's top priority is growing the economy, getting Scotland back to work, and helping you make ends meet. That's why I'm asking for your support in the Scottish elections on 5th May.
issues.education: make sure Scottish students don't pay tuition fees

leaflet.personalStatement: I want to set out how Labour will protect you and your family. Labour will fight to ensure working and retired folk don't suffer to pay the price of Tory policies.
leaflet.additionalNotes: P.S. If you'd prefer to vote by post, give me a call and my team will send you a form.
